Articles.Content: when I name my craft , it seems that the KSP baned Chinese ship names in the real word , like Shenzhou series of sapcecrafts and Change series of  probes and even Changzheng series of rockets. I can't name my crafts using these names.  The version of KSP is v1.2.1 ,I don't have this problem in version 1.0.5 .Does any one have the same problem ? Or any help T T ? thanks...
Hi @xiaomin, do you mean when using Chinese characters?

8 hours ago, sal_vager said:

Hi @xiaomin, do you mean when using Chinese characters?

Yeah,using Chinese characters.

8 hours ago, xiaomin said:

Yeah,using Chinese characters.

This the first I've heard of them not working, sorry but I don't know if there's a way to change this, but Squad is working on adding other languages, hopefully Chinese is one of them.

16 hours ago, sal_vager said:

This the first I've heard of them not working, sorry but I don't know if there's a way to change this, but Squad is working on adding other languages, hopefully Chinese is one of them.

When I use some other common Chinese words to name my craft , it works. But when using the name like Shenzhou No.11, the words will be replace by  square shapes , that's werid ! It lowers the enjoyment T^T.  Anyway , thanks

I'm certain these are not being deliberately blocked, the ☐ symbol is used in unicode as a replacement character to indicate problems when a system is unable to render a stream of data to a correct symbol. It is usually seen when the data is invalid and does not match any character.

Squad will have to expand on supported characters to implement multiple language support, so this should get fixed when the translations become available.
